channel.title: Installing software on Ubuntu?
channel.description: i want to install software on ubuntu linux. i know you go into synaptic package manager but that has only some programs. i wanted to install azureus and i have the set up file( the one for windows ). so can someone tell be how to install it from there because simply double clicking the set up file doesnt work.

item.title: Installing software on Ubuntu?
item.dc:creator: @sidishere sidishere
item.description:
@sidishere wrote:

ok but say i downloaded a setup for azureus thats for linux then how do i install it.

Read full topic

item.title: Installing software on Ubuntu?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Windows is not linux, linux is not windows. Running a windows application on linux does nothing. You can always try googling for torrent programs that work on linux. UTorrent does I believe.

Read full topic

item.title: Installing software on Ubuntu?
item.dc:creator: @DeadBird DeadBird
item.description:
@DeadBird wrote:

sudo apt-cache search azureus

Read full topic
